intro: Eriogonum comosum, commonly known as the bristly buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a distinctive, bristly texture. Eriogonum comosum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
